page.description: Flags opened table to not be closed automatically on termination of script.
page.discussion: Normally, when a script ends, Alpha Anywhere will automatically close any open tables. The <TBL>.PERSIST() method can keep the table open after the script ends, so that a subsequent script can access the table without the overhead of having to open it again.

section.title: Example
section.description: This code is attached to a button on a form. It opens the table and keeps the table open when the script ends.
section.example: dim shared tbl as P tbl = table.open("customer") ' ... do something tbl.persist() ' ... script ends

section.description: This code is attached to another button on a form. It works because the previous script used the .PERSIST() method to keep the table open.
section.example: ' ... new script starts dim shared tbl as P ' ... it is not necessary to reopen the table tbl.enter_begin() tbl.name = "Sam" tbl.enter_end(.T.)
